description:
As an Embedded Protocol Stack Engineer, you will focus on development, integration and customization of modem features on Android devices, working closely with OEM and vendors. You will be the point of contact for all debugging, triaging and fixing modem issues from factory and certification (GCF/PTCRB/IOT/FIT). You will also be responsible for developing power and performance optimized connectivity solutions.

Making the world's information universally accessible and useful doesn't stop at the desktop. The Mobile team builds tools to get you the information you need no matter where you are. Android has become the world's most popular mobile ecosystem, powering billions of devices, from smartphones to tablets, watches to TVs and everything in between. Whether adding to the core Android experience, forging new markets for digital content, creating immersive and portable versions of our products or managing relationships with a global community of developers, the Mobile team is giving you Google on the go.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • MS degree in Engineering or related field or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of experience with 3GPP/3GPP2 standards
  • Experience with Android RIL, Telephony, C and Embedded RTOS. Hands-on development experience in cellular protocol stack (Control and/or Data Plane)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Strong development experience with wireless technologies such as CDMA, E-HRPD, GSM, UMTS, TDS-CDMA, LTE-FDD / LTE-TDD, and 5G
  • Strong knowledge of and experience in Voice (including WFC, VoLTE, ViLTE) and Data Call Performance, System Selection, Power and Performance optimizations, MIPS Optimization and Hardware Accelerators
  • Strong development and domain expertise in Cellular Control or Data Plane Protocol Stack - IP Multimedia Core Network Subsystems (IMS) technologies such as VoLTE/vt, NAS, RRC, RLC, PDCP, MAC, PHY
responsibilities:
• Debug, triage and fix modem issues from factory, certification (GCF/PTCRB/IOT), field performance issues
  • Develop power and performance optimized connectivity solution
  • Develop innovative modem differentiators
  • Support RFI/RFQ and carrier compliance
title: Embedded Protocol Stack Engineer, Modem
